com.mindfusion.scheduling

Class WeekRangeSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mindfusion.scheduling.ViewSettings
      • com.mindfusion.scheduling.WeekRangeSettings

  • public class WeekRangeSettings
extends ViewSettings
    Defines properties that allow customizing the visualization of in WeekRange view.

      • getShowDayOfWeek

        public java.lang.Boolean getShowDayOfWeek()
        Description copied from class: WeekRangeSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether the day names are displayed in the header area of the WeekRange view.

        The day names are obtained from the Calendar.getDateTimeInfo() object.

        Returns:
        true to display the day names; otherwise, false.

      • setShowDayOfWeek

        public void setShowDayOfWeek(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: WeekRangeSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether the day names are displayed in the header area of the WeekRange view.

        The day names are obtained from the Calendar.getDateTimeInfo() object.

        Parameters:
        value - true to display the day names; otherwise, false. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getTimePeriodHeaderHeight

        public java.lang.Integer getTimePeriodHeaderHeight()
        Description copied from class: WeekRangeSettings
        Gets the height of the time-period header in the WeekRange view.

        A value of 0 causes the height to be calculated automatically based on the size of the header font.

        Returns:
        A non-negative integer value specifying the header height in pixels.

      • setTimePeriodHeaderHeight

        public void setTimePeriodHeaderHeight(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: WeekRangeSettings

        A value of 0 causes the height to be calculated automatically based on the size of the header font.

        Parameters:
        value - A non-negative integer value specifying the header height in pixels. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getReferenceHeaderHeight

        public java.lang.Integer getReferenceHeaderHeight()
        Description copied from class: WeekRangeSettings
        Gets the height of the resource header in the WeekRange view.

        This header is where the contact, task, location or resource names are displayed, depending on Calendar.getGroupType(). A value of 0 causes the height to be calculated automatically based on the size of the header font.

        Returns:
        A non-negative integer value specifying the header height.

      • setReferenceHeaderHeight

        public void setReferenceHeaderHeight(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: WeekRangeSettings
        Sets the height of the resource header in the WeekRange view.

        This header is where the contact, task, location or resource names are displayed, depending on Calendar.getGroupType(). A value of 0 causes the height to be calculated automatically based on the size of the header font.

        Parameters:
        value - A non-negative integer value specifying the header height. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getNumberOfDays

        public int getNumberOfDays()
        Description copied from class: WeekRangeSettings
        Gets the total number of days displayed in the WeekRange view.

        Use the setDate and setEndDate methods of the Calendar component to set the time period displayed in the week range view.

        Returns:
        An integer value specifying how many days are contained in the week range view.

      • getVisibleRows

        public java.lang.Integer getVisibleRows()
        Description copied from class: WeekRangeSettings
        Gets the number of weeks visible at a time.

        Used only when WeekRangeSettings.getViewStyle() is set to WeekRangeViewStyle.WeekPerRow.

        Returns:
        The allowed values range from 1 to 10.

      • setVisibleRows

        public void setVisibleRows(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: WeekRangeSettings
        Sets the number of weeks visible at a time.

        Used only when WeekRangeSettings.getViewStyle() is set to WeekRangeViewStyle.WeekPerRow.

        Parameters:
        value - The allowed values range from 1 to 10. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getGroupWeekends

        public java.lang.Boolean getGroupWeekends()
        Description copied from class: WeekRangeSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether weekend days are grouped in a single calendar cell. Weekends are always grouped in a SingleWeek view.
        Returns:
        true to display weekend days together; otherwise, false.

      • setGroupWeekends

        public void setGroupWeekends(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: WeekRangeSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether weekend days are grouped in a single calendar cell. Weekends are always grouped in a SingleWeek view.
        Parameters:
        value - true to display weekend days together; otherwise, false. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getHeaderShadowOffset

        public java.lang.Integer getHeaderShadowOffset()
        Description copied from class: WeekRangeSettings
        Gets the offset of the shadows from the headers that cast them.
        Returns:
        An integer value specifying with how many pixels to offset a header's shadow from the header. The allowed values range from 1 to 5.

      • setHeaderShadowOffset

        public void setHeaderShadowOffset(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: WeekRangeSettings
        Sets the offset of the shadows from the headers that cast them.
        Parameters:
        value - An integer value specifying with how many pixels to offset a header's shadow from the header. The allowed values range from 1 to 5. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getVisibleColumns

        public java.lang.Integer getVisibleColumns()
        Description copied from class: WeekRangeSettings
        Gets the number of columns visible when Calendar.getGroupType() is enabled.

        In the week range view schedule data can be displayed in several columns grouped by contact, location, task or resource, as set in Calendar.getGroupType(). This property determines how many parallel columns are visible at a time.

        Returns:
        A positive integer value specifying how many columns are visible simultaneously.

      • setVisibleColumns

        public void setVisibleColumns(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: WeekRangeSettings
        Sets the number of columns visible when Calendar.getGroupType() is enabled.

        In the week range view schedule data can be displayed in several columns grouped by contact, location, task or resource, as set in Calendar.getGroupType(). This property determines how many parallel columns are visible at a time.

        Parameters:
        value - A positive integer value specifying how many columns are visible simultaneously. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.
